metadata.title: CVE-2022-46340 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This security flaw occurs becuase theswap handler for the XTestFakeInput request of the XTest extension maycorrupt the stack if GenericEvents with lengths larger than 32 bytes aresent through a the XTestFakeInput request. This issue can lead to localprivileges elevation on systems where the X server is running privilegedand remote code execution for ssh X forwarding sessions. This issue doesnot affect systems where client and server use the same byte order.

criterions.comment: xorg-server: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-hwe-16.04: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
